Straightshot looks to Torca with a thumbs up.

" Direct hit, nice one Torca=
!  Oh before he gets up, think you could blast the rock that's over him for=
 me?  If ya get what I'm getting at."

She points to a large structure of r=
ock that's over the cave.

Meanwhile, Quickstride was getting tired of the =
Sharkitcons and gets into robot mode bearing his over the shoulder blast ca=
nnon.

" Okay, that's it, it's fish frying time!  Heads up Rattrap!"

Rattr=
ap quickly scoots out of Quickstrides way.

" FIRE IN THE HOLE!"

Quickstri=
de now attempts to take out a large group of Sharkticons with a shot from t=
he blast cannon.

Tucson concentrates and remains focused as he continues t=
o match Magmatrons moves simply to defend himself against his onslaught.  H=
e knew his sword was not big as Magmatrons nor was it made to handle its po=
wer.  Knowing that, he opts not to use the sword.    Narrowing a brow in th=
ought he quickly goes from robot to beast mode, landing on his hind feet an=
d using his front legs as arms and hands.     

The sword may not have the =
strength nor the size but he knew his tail could be strong and long enough =
of a weapon for him.  With surprising grace he whirls the tail masterfully =
into a coil and slaps at Magmatrons sword to attempt a tail block by slappi=
ng it with the side of the skinnier part of his long tail with a forceful s=
wipe.  His long neck coils back like that of a serpent ready to strike.  Ye=
t he remains calm without any explosive temperamental outbursts.

" A worth=
y opponent indeed.  But can you face me in  your own beast mode as I am fac=
ing you in mine?  You seem attached to your robot mode, Magmatron, is there=
 something you're not telling me, about your level of expertise?  Or is it =
that because you are contrived of a mixture of creatures that are not known=
 for combative agility?  As you can well imagine, a dragon faces similar we=
aknesses.  And you may ask yourself why would a dragon take on a posture th=
at would expose him to injury?  Or is it that the dragon may have learned t=
o adapt to such weaknesses?  Now I'm sure you're a very charismatic individ=
ual but, are you witty enough to step outside the box?  Let's see if you ar=
e.  Come on then, I'm sure a beast of your caliber can make short work of a=
 smaller mountain dragon.  Show me what you're really made of, transform, a=
nd face me in your beast mode!  I dare you to do the unusual!"
